snippet: Martin Davis plunged into a container of hydrofluoric acid when the roof at Swepco Tube in Clifton, N.J., partly collapsed.
abstract: Roofer Martin Davis falls through a partly collapsed roof into a container of hydrofluoric acid at a building in Clifton, NJ, suffering critical injuries. (S)1
lead_paragraph: A New Jersey roofer fell 30 to 40 feet through a partly collapsed roof into a container of acid on Monday and was rescued by co-workers, including one who jumped in to grab him, fire officials in Clifton, N.J., said. The roofer, Martin Davis, 44, was working on the roof of Swepco Tube, a pipe and tube manufacturer in Clifton, when part of the roof gave away and he plunged into a container of hydrofluoric acid, which fire officials said measured about 5 feet deep and 30 feet long. He was critically injured.

headline.main: New Jersey Roofer Falls Into Acid Vat
